DOCNAME: CASE OF MUTSOLGOVA AND OTHERS v. RUSSIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 2 (substantive aspect);Violation of Art. 2;Violation of Art. 3;Violation of Art. 5;Violation of Art. 13
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;Elisabeth Steiner;Khanlar Hajiyev;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants are :
PERSON , born in DATE ;
Mr PERSON , born in DATE ;
Mr PERSON , born in DATE ;
PERSON , born in DATE , and
PERSON , born in DATE .

CARDINAL . The applicants live in the town of PERSON , in GPE . The first and second applicants are the parents of PERSON Bashir ORG , born in DATE . The third applicant is his brother . The fourth and fifth applicants are PERSON wife and daughter .

CARDINAL . At the material time the fourth and the fifth applicants together with PERSON lived at CARDINAL FAC in the town of PERSON , PERSON . The first and second applicants lived in a house nearby , QUANTITY away .

CARDINAL . The applicants were not eyewitnesses to PERSON abduction and the following account of events is based on the witness statements collected by them after his disappearance and on other documents furnished by them to the ORG .

CARDINAL . At TIME on DATE PERSON , who was heading from the grocery store to his home , met a neighbour , PERSON Kh . The men were talking next to PERSON house when a white VAZ-CARDINAL ( “ PERSON ) vehicle with blacked - out windows and a dark blue CARDINAL car pulled over . Although the vehicles ' registration plates were covered with mud , the GPE had part of its number , “ CARDINAL ” , visible . CARDINAL masked men in camouflage uniforms emerged from the cars . They were armed with AK assault rifles and spoke unaccented NORP . The men ran up to PERSON and ORG Kh . and hit the latter in the face so that he fell to the ground . They then forced PERSON into the white PERSON vehicle . According to the statement by PERSON , PERSON was forced to the ground and then put in the FAC vehicle . Kh . Kh . submitted in his statement that , before being forced into the FAC vehicle , PERSON had been hit with a rifle - butt in the stomach .

CARDINAL . PERSON 's neighbour , Ya . Kh . , heard a noise and looked out of the window of her house . She saw across the street a group of men throw PERSON into the white PERSON vehicle . After that the vehicles with PERSON drove away in the direction of the PERSON department of the interior ( “ the ORG ” ) and the local road police station ( “ the GPE station ” ) located QUANTITY from PERSON house .

CARDINAL . A number of other local residents witnessed the abduction of PERSON . In particular , prior to arriving at PERSON house , the white Niva vehicle had caused a traffic accident with CARDINAL minivans which both had CARDINAL passengers on board . The passengers in the minivans , as well as their drivers , including ORG , and the crowd gathered at the place of the accident witnessed the abduction of PERSON ORG by a group of armed masked men .

CARDINAL . One of the local residents , PERSON , was driving past the applicants ' house when he saw a group of armed men throw a man into a white Niva vehicle . TIME , passing by the GPE station , he informed the on - duty officer PERSON . about the incident and told him that CARDINAL vehicles , a white GPE and a dark blue PERSON with the abducted man , were driving behind him on the same road . PERSON . stopped the CARDINAL cars . A man of NORP appearance , DATE , got out of the white Niva vehicle . He spoke unaccented NORP and produced a special permit of ORG of ORG ( “ ORG Штаб ORG ” ) , prohibiting any search of the permit owner and his vehicle . The man introduced himself as an officer of the ORG and ordered PERSON . to let the CARDINAL vehicles through . PERSON . recognised him as the man who had been introduced to him as an ORG officer during an investigation into an explosion in PERSON , and who had participated in the investigation together with other ORG officers . Having checked the permit , PERSON . let the CARDINAL vehicles pass . From the GPE station the CARDINAL vehicles took the GPE and drove in the direction of the town of PERSON , PERSON .
CARDINAL . The applicants have had no news of PERSON since DATE .

CARDINAL . The above description of the events of DATE is based , among other things , on the applicants ' application form dated CARDINAL DATE ; written statements by ORG and ORG of DATE ; written statements by Ya . Kh . and ORG Kh . made on DATE ; a written statement by the third applicant made on DATE ; written statements by the first and second applicants dated DATE , and a hand - drawn map of the LOC at FAC in PERSON with detailed indications of the objects and persons at the time of the abduction and the direction taken by the abductors .

CARDINAL . In their statements the first to third applicants referred to the time of PERSON abduction as approximately TIME ; according to the statements by PERSON . Kh . and Ya . Kh . , it occurred “ at TIME ” According to all witness and applicants ' statements submitted to ORG , there had been CARDINAL abductors who had arrived in a white PERSON and a dark blue ORG vehicle ; PERSON had been put into the white FAC vehicle .

CARDINAL . The Government submitted that on DATE at CARDINAL p.m. , a group of unidentified armed men in camouflage uniforms had forced PERSON into a white FAC vehicle near house no . CARDINAL at FAC in PERSON and had taken him to an unknown destination .

CARDINAL . NORP Immediately after the abduction of PERSON , at QUANTITY on DATE , Ya . Kh . alerted the first , second and third applicants about their relative 's abduction . At TIME the applicants complained about PERSON abduction to a number of local law enforcement agencies , including the ORG . The authorities denied having arrested the applicants ' relative .

CARDINAL . On DATE or DATE the third applicant 's car was stopped by a grey VAZ-CARDINAL vehicle with blacked - out windows and without number plates . CARDINAL men in camouflage uniforms got out of the vehicle , while the driver stayed inside . CARDINAL of them , aged TIME and of NORP appearance , approached the third applicant and identified himself as an ORG officer , but refused to provide his name . He carried a PERSON pistol – the usual equipment of members of the NORP “ power structures ” . He told the third applicant that he could provide him with information on the whereabouts of PERSON in exchange for CARDINAL United States dollars ( ORG ) . The officer described in detail the clothing worn by PERSON on DATE of his abduction .

CARDINAL . Having received the money , the officer told the applicant that his brother had been abducted by a group of officers of the ORG department of the ORG , the GPE department of the ORG and ORG of the ORG in LOC ( УФСБ по Республике Ингушетии , PERSON и ORG по PERSON ) . The officer told the applicant that after the abduction PERSON had been taken to the ORG department of the ORG in PERSON and had been detained in a basement . The following day , presumably on DATE , PERSON had allegedly been taken by CARDINAL grey ORG vehicles ( “ таблетка ” ) to the LOC settlement in GPE , where the main base of the NORP military forces was located . According to the officer , while in detention PERSON had been subjected to beatings and torture with a view to making him confess to an unspecified crime he had not committed .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date in DATE the third applicant met with an acquaintance who had come over with a young armed man in a camouflage uniform , who was carrying a pistol . The latter spoke PERSON and introduced himself as an officer of the ORG headquarters in PERSON . In exchange for ORG CARDINAL he promised to find out more information about PERSON . On DATE the applicant met with him again . According to the officer , on DATE a man answering to the description of PERSON had been brought to the ORG headquarters in PERSON and taken into the building through a side entrance .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE , when returning from his parents ' home , the third applicant was allegedly approached by a young man in a camouflage uniform and a black knitted hat , who called the third applicant by name . He spoke LANGUAGE without accent . The man identified himself as an ORG officer and showed the third applicant a dark - red or brown certificate with a laminated picture . The third applicant could not read the man 's family name on the certificate because it was dark and the latter was covering it with his fingers . Having showed the certificate the man told the third applicant that he was not going to identify himself because “ if ( the third applicant ) fell into the hands of the ORG he would tell them everything ” . While the man was talking , the third applicant noticed CARDINAL grey PERSON vehicles and a white ORG vehicle on the opposite side of the street . The man offered to give the third applicant the name of CARDINAL of PERSON abductors in exchange for MONEY . The third applicant asked him to give the name of the officer who had shown PERSON . a special permit at the GPE station , thinking that PERSON . would be able to identify that officer during an eventual confrontation . The man agreed and the third applicant gave him ORG CARDINAL and PERSON picture , with the third applicant 's mobile number written on its reverse side . The remainder of the amount was to be paid on receipt of the information .

CARDINAL . On DATE the third applicant allegedly received a call on his mobile . A man who did not identify himself told him that the person who had abducted PERSON and shown the special permit at the GPE station was PERSON , an officer of the ORG department in GPE . DATE an unidentified person visited the third applicant at TIME to obtain the remaining CARDINAL and allegedly told the third applicant that PERSON was serving in the ORG with the rank of lieutenant - colonel .

CARDINAL . In their search for PERSON the applicants also contacted , both in person and in writing , various official bodies , such as the NORP President , ORG , the Envoy of the President of GPE in GPE , the administration of GPE and departments of the interior and prosecutors ' offices at different levels , describing in detail the circumstances of their relative 's abduction and asking for help in establishing his whereabouts . The applicants retained copies of a number of those letters and submitted them to the ORG .

CARDINAL . Following the applicants ' complaint about PERSON abduction , at TIME on DATE CARDINAL law - enforcement officers arrived at the applicants ' house . They introduced themselves as the head of the local department of the fight against organised crime ( the ORG ) and the district police officer . The officers interviewed an unspecified number of witnesses to the abduction of PERSON .

CARDINAL . According to the third applicant , on DATE he went to the PERSON town prosecutor 's office ( “ the town prosecutor 's office ” ) to submit a written complaint about his brother 's abduction . He was received by investigator PERSON , who refused to accept his complaint and first called , in the third applicant 's presence , the ORG department in ORG and asked them whether their officials had carried out special operations in PERSON . O. then allegedly asked his interlocutor on the phone whether he could accept the third applicant 's complaint about the abduction of his brother . O. then told the third applicant that , according his interlocutor , the ORG department in ORG had not carried out any special operations or arrests in PERSON and that he had been allowed to accept the third applicant 's complaint .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor 's office of GPE ( “ the NORP prosecutor 's office ” ) forwarded the third applicant 's complaint about the abduction of PERSON to the town prosecutor 's office for examination .

CARDINAL . On DATE the town prosecutor 's office instituted an investigation into the abduction of PERSON under LAW ( aggravated kidnapping ) . The case file was given number DATE ( in the submitted documents the number is also referred to as CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . By a letter of CARDINAL DATE the town prosecutor 's office informed the third applicant that a criminal investigation into the abduction of PERSON had been opened . The decision stated , in particular , that at TIME on DATE unidentified persons in camouflage uniforms , who had arrived in a FAC vehicle and a CARDINAL vehicle , had forced PERSON into CARDINAL of the vehicles near CARDINAL FAC and had taken him to an unknown destination . By a letter of the same date addressed to the third applicant the latter , as well as “ other relatives ” of PERSON , were requested to come to the town prosecutor 's office for an interview and eventual recognition as victims in that criminal case .

CARDINAL . On DATE the second applicant complained to the military prosecutor 's office of military unit no . CARDINAL that his son had been abducted by armed men in camouflage uniforms in several vehicles . He pointed out that when the abductors had been stopped at the GPE station , CARDINAL of them had produced a special permit which had allowed the cars to pass without being checked . The second applicant also stated that he had managed to find out that PERSON had been abducted by officers of the ORG department of the ORG , the GPE department of the ORG and ORG of the ORG in the LOC ; that he had been taken to the headquarters of the FAC department of the ORG in PERSON and put into a basement ; that on DATE his son had been taken to the settlement of GPE in GPE , where he had been and was still detained . According to the second applicant that information had been provided by officers of the above - mentioned departments of the ORG who had asked that their names not be disclosed ; they had also told the second applicant that PERSON had been subjected to beatings and torture and pressurised to confess to an unspecified crime . The second applicant emphasised that both he and the first applicant were suffering because they knew nothing about their son 's fate and had no information about what was being done about it by the investigating authorities .
CARDINAL . On DATE the third applicant was granted victim status in criminal case no . DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG department of the ORG informed the military prosecutor 's office of military unit no . CARDINAL that they had not arrested PERSON and had no information concerning his whereabouts .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigators in criminal case no . DATE issued a statement concerning the progress of the investigation . The document provided , inter alia , a detailed description of the circumstances of PERSON abduction and stated that he had not committed any crimes and that his name had not been on the authorities ' wanted list . According to the document , the investigation had questioned a number of witnesses to the abduction , including officer PERSON . and PERSON The document , in so far as relevant , continues as follows :

In his explanation of DATE officer PERSON . of the ORG submitted that on DATE , while he was on duty at the Kursk - I GPE station , ... DATE , he was approached by an acquaintance PERSON who had told him that ... he was being followed by a green CARDINAL vehicle and a white Niva vehicle ; he saw a man being forced into one of those vehicles - those vehicles had been closely following PERSON

ORG . ordered the CARDINAL vehicles to stop . The FAC vehicle was in front and was followed by a CARDINAL vehicle ; neither of them had registration plates . The driver of the Niva vehicle had got out and had shown [ PERSON . ] a special permit exempting the vehicles and the persons inside from checking . PERSON . recognised the driver as an officer of the ORG department of the ORG , whom he had seen earlier in connection with various incidents , most recently at the scene of a crime at CARDINAL Chkalova Street , where , as a result of an explosion , a ORG officer , ORG , had had his hand torn off . PERSON . did not know the family name of the ORG officer but could identify him at any time . PERSON . described [ that officer 's ] distinctive marks .
At his interview on DATE PERSON . gave a similar statement .

Witness PERSON in his explanation and during his interview on DATE submitted that on DATE , at TIME , when he had been driving towards the centre of PERSON , ... CARDINAL armed persons had stepped into the road and stopped the traffic . At the same moment , their accomplices had forced a young man , who had previously been held in the CARDINAL vehicle , into the white GPE and taken him away ; PERSON had informed the GPE station located near the ORG about this . The on - duty officer had stopped vehicles without licence plates , checked their documents and let them through . In answer to PERSON question why he had let them pass , the officer answered that he knew one of them as an ORG officer . From [ PERSON . 's ] explanation PERSON understood that the ORG officers had not abducted but arrested PERSON . PERSON would not be able to identify those persons because they had been wearing masks ....
According to a certificate of the head of the ORG dated DATE , on DATE PERSON , born in DATE , had been taken to an unknown destination by officers of the power structures ... ”

CARDINAL . In a letter of CARDINAL DATE the military prosecutor 's office of military unit no . CARDINAL informed the second applicant that the examination of his complaint had established that officers of the FAC and GPE departments of the ORG had not participated in the abduction of PERSON . According to the letter , the military prosecutor 's office of ORG ( the ORG military prosecutor 's office ) had forwarded a request for assistance in the search for PERSON to ORG of the ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the NORP prosecutor 's office informed the second applicant that they had studied the case concerning the abduction of PERSON and had issued instructions for the investigation aimed at establishing the identity of the perpetrators of his abduction . According to the letter , the authorities were verifying the thesis of possible involvement of the ORG officers in the abduction and his detention in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the second applicant complained about PERSON ORG 's abduction to the head of the ORG of the Russian Federation and ORG . He described in detail the circumstances of his son 's abduction by armed men in camouflage uniforms in several vehicles and pointed out that when the abductors had been stopped at the GPE station CARDINAL of them had produced a special permit which had allowed the vehicles to pass without a check . The second applicant also stated that he had managed to find out that his son had been abducted by officers of the Ingushetia department of the ORG , the GPE department of the ORG and ORG of the ORG in the LOC ; that he had been taken to the headquarters of the FAC department of the ORG in PERSON and put in a basement ; that on DATE his son had been taken to the settlement of GPE in GPE , where he was still detained . According to the second applicant , that information had been provided to him by officers of the above - mentioned departments of the ORG , who had asked him not to disclose their names ; they had also told the second applicant that PERSON had been subjected to beatings and torture and pressurised to confess to an unspecified crime . Lastly , he stressed that both he and the first applicant had experienced enormous suffering because of the lack of news about their son and the investigating authorities ' failure to take any measures to find him or to identify the perpetrators .

CARDINAL . By a letter of CARDINAL DATE the NORP prosecutor 's office informed the second applicant that his complaint about the abduction of PERSON had been forwarded to the town prosecutor 's office for examination .

CARDINAL . By a letter of CARDINAL DATE the town prosecutor 's office informed the second applicant that they had opened a criminal investigation into his son 's abduction ; that they were verifying the information submitted by the second applicant during the preliminary investigation , and that he would be given any relevant information in due course .

CARDINAL . On DATE the NORP prosecutor 's office wrote to the second applicant that the town prosecutor 's office had opened a criminal investigation into his son 's abduction and that operational and search measures were under way . The letter stated the investigation of the criminal case was under the control of the NORP prosecutor 's office .

CARDINAL . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE the town prosecutor 's office suspended the investigation in criminal case no . DATE for failure to identify the perpetrators and establish PERSON whereabouts ; the operational and search measures aimed at identification of the culprits were to be continued .

CARDINAL . NORP In a letter of CARDINAL DATE the third applicant requested the town prosecutor 's office to provide him with information on the status and the progress in the investigation into his brother 's abduction .
CARDINAL . On DATE the third applicant wrote to the town prosecutor 's office seeking detailed information on the investigation in case no . DATE and access to the case file .

CARDINAL . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE the town prosecutor 's office refused his request , stating that the third applicant would be allowed to have detailed information concerning the investigation and access to the case file materials only when the investigation was complete . In a letter of DATE the town prosecutor 's office notified the third applicant accordingly and provided him with copies of CARDINAL procedural decisions issued by it : the decision to open the criminal investigation ; the decision to grant the third applicant victim status , and the decision to suspend the investigation .

CARDINAL . On DATE the third applicant requested the town prosecutor 's office to reopen the investigation in case no . DATE and to carry out additional investigative measures . In particular , he asked the authorities to compile a photofit image of CARDINAL of the abductors based on the statements by officer PERSON . and to conduct an identification procedure .

CARDINAL . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE the town prosecutor 's office granted the third applicant 's request concerning the photofit image . The decision also stated that the third applicant was to be notified of it . It is unclear whether the requested investigative measures have been carried out by the authorities .
CARDINAL . On DATE the NORP prosecutor 's office informed the third applicant that the investigation in criminal case no . DATE had been resumed on an unspecified date .

CARDINAL . On DATE the third applicant wrote to the town prosecutor 's office , submitting that on DATE an unidentified man had told him on the phone that CARDINAL of PERSON abductors was Mr PERSON , an officer of the GPE department of the ORG . In connection with that information the third applicant requested the authorities to carry out the following investigative measures in criminal case no . DATE : establishing whether PERSON was indeed an ORG officer in the GPE region ; establishing whether he had been stationed in ORG on DATE ; having his photograph identified by officer PERSON . and carrying out of a confrontation between officer PERSON . and officer PERSON , the third applicant requested to be informed about the results .

CARDINAL . By a decision of DATE the town prosecutor 's office granted the third applicant 's request . On DATE third applicant was informed about it . It is unclear whether the investigating authorities took any of the requested measures .
CARDINAL . On DATE the town prosecutor 's office informed the third applicant that the investigation in criminal case no . DATE had been resumed on an unspecified date .
DATE . On DATE the third applicant wrote to the town prosecutor 's office seeking access to the case file materials in criminal case no . DATE and permission to make copies of them .

CARDINAL . On DATE the town prosecutor 's office informed the third applicant that his request for access to the case file had been refused and that the applicant would be allowed to have access to it only when the investigation was complete .
CARDINAL . It appears that the investigation into the abduction of PERSON is still pending .
CARDINAL . On DATE the town prosecutor 's office instituted a criminal investigation into the abduction of PERSON under LAW of LAW . The case file was assigned the number DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the third applicant was granted victim status in connection with the proceedings in case no . DATE .

CARDINAL . On being questioned as a victim on DATE , the third applicant submitted that on DATE at TIME unidentified persons wearing masks had abducted and taken away his brother , PERSON . According to eyewitnesses to the abduction , CARDINAL unidentified persons had arrived in CARDINAL blue CARDINAL vehicles without number plates and a white Niva vehicle whose number plates were covered with mud but the number CARDINAL was visible on it .

CARDINAL . During an additional interview as a victim the third applicant explained that on DATE , at TIME a person unknown to him had called him on his mobile phone and had stated that CARDINAL of the abductors of the third applicant 's brother had been PERSON , officer of the NORP regional or town department of the ORG .

CARDINAL . According to the Government , Ya . Kh . , interviewed on an unspecified date , stated that at TIME on DATE she had been in her house at CARDINAL NORP Street , PERSON . Looking out of the window she had seen several unidentified armed men in masks and camouflage uniforms force PERSON into a FAC vehicle and leave thereafter in the direction of GPE . Ya . PERSON . would not be able to identify those persons .

CARDINAL . M.B. , questioned as a witness on an unspecified date , submitted that at TIME on DATE he had been driving along FAC . As he was passing the GPE café , he had seen CARDINAL unidentified people step into the road and stop the traffic . Other unidentified people put a young man into a white Niva vehicle and went off with him towards the GPE settlement , the CARDINAL vehicle following the GPE . When the CARDINAL vehicles turned into FAC , PERSON told an on - duty police officer at the Kursk - I GPE station what he had seen . The police officer had checked the documents of the drivers and passengers in the vehicles and let them through . In reply to PERSON 's question as to why they had not been stopped , the police officer answered that an ORG officer of the ORG department of the ORG had been in one of the vehicles .

CARDINAL . According to the ORG , officer PERSON . , questioned as a witness on an unspecified date , stated that on DATE he had been on duty at the GPE station in PERSON . PERSON applied to him , saying that armed persons driving CARDINAL vehicles without number plates had arrested PERSON and had been taking him in the direction of the GPE station . When PERSON . stopped those vehicles the driver of the PERSON showed a special permit allowing unhindered passage for his vehicle . PERSON . did not pay attention to the name on the permit , as the driver was an officer of the ORG department whom PERSON . had previously met , most recently on DATE at the scene of a crime at CARDINAL Chkalova Street in PERSON .

CARDINAL . During an additional interview as a witness PERSON . confirmed his earlier statement in full but submitted that , owing to the time which had elapsed since the abduction of PERSON , he would not be able to identify the ORG officer who had shown him the special permit .

CARDINAL . According to the Government , officers PERSON , PERSON , PERSON . , T. , NORP and PERSON . of the GPE station , interviewed as witnesses , made statements similar to those given by officer PERSON .

CARDINAL . According to the Government , PERSON , interviewed as a witness on an unspecified date , stated that , as a senior officer of the NORP regional department of the ORG , he had been stationed in ORG from DATE to CARDINAL DATE . On DATE he had been at his permanent post in GPE .

CARDINAL . The Government further submitted that unspecified authorities had requested that the ORG department of the ORG provide information in connection with officer PERSON . 's statements . From their reply it followed that officers of that authority had not been at the crime scene at CARDINAL Chkalova Street , PERSON .

CARDINAL . With a view to establishing PERSON whereabouts and obtaining information on whether he had been arrested or prosecuted , the investigation sent out requests [ поручение ] to numerous authorities , including unspecified prosecutors of GPE , heads of the ORG departments in LOC and the UGA military prosecutor 's office . According to the replies of those ORG bodies , he was not under arrest or criminal prosecution and his whereabouts were unknown .

CARDINAL . From the replies of the ORG , and the remand centres in the ORG , PERSON , PERSON , GPE , ORG , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , LAW and NORP districts , as well as several remand centres in the GPE - GPE , it followed that PERSON was not detained in those detention facilities .

CARDINAL . The investigation in the case concerning PERSON abduction had been repeatedly suspended for failure to identify those responsible and subsequently resumed with a view to verifying new information . It found no evidence that PERSON had been abducted by ORG officials or that he was not alive . The investigation in case no . DATE was pending .

CARDINAL . NORP Despite specific requests by ORG , the ORG refused to furnish any copies from the investigation file in case no . DATE . They claimed that the investigation was in progress and that disclosure of the documents would be in violation of LAW and would “ breach the rights of the parties to the criminal proceedings ” . Neither did the Government indicate the exact dates or provide any further details of the witness ' interviews and other investigative measures referred to in their submissions to the ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the third applicant complained to ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) that the investigation in criminal case no . DATE was ineffective . He submitted , among other things , that it had taken the district prosecutor 's office an unjustifiably long time to launch the investigation ; that the main witness , officer PERSON . , had only been questioned DATE after the opening of the investigation and that the district prosecutor 's office had failed to take the most basic investigative steps in due time . In particular , they had failed to interview some witnesses and to compile a photofit image of the abductor who had shown the special passage permit at the GPE station . Despite the information concerning PERSON , the investigation had failed to check it with the relevant ORG departments . On a more general level , the third applicant complained that he had had to beg for each and every investigative measure and that the investigating authorities had carried them out only after numerous requests from him , which was demonstrated by his voluminous correspondence with the town prosecutor 's office . Lastly , the third applicant stressed that the numerous omissions in the investigation had made it impossible to solve his brother 's abduction and to identify and punish the persons responsible for it , and that the culprits had been able to conceal the traces of their crime forever . He also averred that those omissions had been in breach of LAW .

DATE . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE ORG dismissed the third applicant 's complaint as unfounded . The court found that , having received the third applicant 's complaint about the abduction of PERSON on DATE , the town prosecutor 's office , had sent a query to the ORG department of the ORG on DATE to find out whether they had arrested the applicant 's brother . The reply to that query had been received only on DATE and on DATE the town prosecutor 's office had instituted criminal proceedings into the abduction . The town prosecutor 's office could not have instituted the proceedings earlier ; it had had first to satisfy itself that PERSON had not been lawfully arrested .
CARDINAL . In respect of the remainder of the third applicant 's complaints , ORG held as follows :
“ ... As to the submission about the belated interviewing of officer PERSON . , who had seen one of the abductors , the following should be noted .

It follows from the materials available to the court that ... [ on DATE ] the head of the ORG had been requested to carry out operational and search measures aimed at liberating PERSON and identifying his abductors . Analogous requests had been sent to [ various departments of ORG ] of GPE . On DATE the ORG prosecutor and the prosecutors of the ORG and GPE had been requested to verify whether any law - enforcement authorities responsible to them had arrested PERSON . Those requests had been repeatedly sent to those authorities in DATE .... Those requests could not have given an immediate result . Before interviewing witnesses it is necessary to identify them . As early as DATE the deputy prosecutor of ORG had issued a written direction to for witness PERSON . to be interviewed . Those directions have been complied with in full and within the time - limits set ...

The complainant also submits that , despite the information implicating PERSON in the crime , the investigation had failed to verify it . However , from the prosecutor 's submissions it transpires that the check conducted by the prosecutor 's office had established that PERSON had not been involved in the abduction of PERSON .
The suspension of the investigation in view of the failure to identify the persons having committed the abduction of PERSON is in accordance with the requirements of LAW of the ORG . ”

CARDINAL . The third applicant appealed against the decision , submitting that ORG reasoning concerning the promptness of the institution of the investigation was absurd . In particular , applying that reasoning , the investigating authorities would be free not to institute a criminal investigation for DATE if the authority which they had requested to provide the information failed to reply in due time . He further challenged the court 's finding that the investigation had carried out all necessary steps and had taken them in due time . In particular , he stressed that the investigation had not confronted officer PERSON . and officer PERSON , although the former expressly stated that he had seen PERSON at the scene of an explosion where PERSON was working in a group of ORG officers and had identified himself as an ORG officer . Lastly , the third applicant pointed out that the photofit image of the abductor seen by officer PERSON . had been compiled DATE after the opening of the investigation and after the applicant 's repeated requests .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE dismissed the third applicant 's appeal , having found that the investigating authorities had taken all necessary measures to find the missing man and those involved in the abduction .
CARDINAL . For a summary of the relevant domestic law see PERSON and PERSON GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL , CARDINAL DATE ) .
